title: 543 West 122nd Street #20D
description:
A BEAUTIFUL OASIS IN MORNINGSIDE HEIGHTS!

The Vandewater is a new condominium building rising atop of a knoll in the charming Morningside Heights neighborhood. This striking one-bedroom apartment is a corner unit with two walls of casement windows facing north and east. The views include portions of the Hudson River and the East River and beyond. This home is bathed in abundant light with a feeling of airiness provided by the 9 feet plus ceilings.

The apartment includes beautiful interior design features such as European white oak floors, recessed LED lighting, customized closets, a full set of window shades, central air and climate control plus a set of washer and dryer units. A windowed kitchen offers quartzite counters, Miele appliances, custom oak cabinetry and a breakfast bar. The sizeable bedroom faces east with open views and adjoins the bathroom which is highlighted with Windsor Cream marble, custom oak vanity and a soaking tub with pewter shower fixtures.

Virtually every desirable amenity can be found at The Vandewater, located just a few doors from Broadway and two short blocks to Riverside Park. Besides a full-time doorman and an on-site concierge, the building provides residents with a private garden, a great room with complete catering kitchen, a salon with fireplace, a large screen viewing room, a music practice room, two playrooms and a state-of-the-art fitness center which includes a 70-foot heated pool, private saunas and a yoga room.

title: 605 West 111st Street #63
description:
Located in the vibrant Morningside Heights neighborhood, just a short walk from Columbia University, this beautiful, spacious 2-bedroom, 1-bathroom apartment is a true gem. Boasting a generous layout, the interior features open spaces with clean lines that create an inviting atmosphere. Each room offers ample space for relaxation and creativity, while the modern kitchen and bathroom are designed for both functionality and comfort. The apartment is filled with natural light, enhancing its warm ambiance and making it the perfect place for you to settle down and call home.

This charming residence at 605 West 11th Street is housed within a beautifully preserved co-op building, originally constructed in 1905 and showcasing the elegant Beaux-Arts architectural style. The Markenfield, as the building is known, rises gracefully over six stories and is home to fifty-two units. Its rich history and meticulously maintained fa ade radiates a sense of timeless charm.

With the amenities, you'll find the convenience of a resident superintendent dedicated to ensuring the upkeep of the building. Additional amenities include a secure bike room for cycling enthusiasts and a well-equipped laundry room that adds to the apartment's practicality. This apartment offers the perfect blend of historic elegance and modern convenience, making it an ideal place to create lasting memories.

About Morningside Heights: Its boundaries extend from Riverside Drive to Morningside Park and from 110th Street to 125th Street.

Once referred to as the Academic Acropolis of Manhattan due to its numerous scholarly institutions-Columbia University, Barnard College, the Manhattan School of Music, Teachers College, and the Cathedral of St. John the Divine, the world's largest Gothic church, to name a few-Morningside Heights is also culturally rich in commerce. The area boasts many cafes, restaurants, entertainment venues, open-air markets, and specialty shops.

Convenient subway stations, such as the #1 at 110th and Broadway, the B and C lines at 110th and Central Park West, and the crosstown bus at 110th and Broadway, make this location ideal for reaching all areas of the city.

Please, no pets of any kind.

title: 100 Claremont Avenue #14D
description:
Perched high above the city with sweeping eastern views, Residence 14D at Claremont Hall is a sophisticated one-bedroom sanctuary spanning 706 square feet. Bathed in natural light through expansive, high-performance windows, this thoughtfully designed home features an open-concept living and dining area, a windowed bathroom with a luxurious walk-in shower, and a primary bedroom adorned with a striking wall of windows.

Crafted with meticulous attention to detail by the renowned Robert A.M. Stern Architects, Claremont Hall residences boast an exquisite finish palette. The home welcomes you with a custom-designed solid wood entrance door with polished chrome hardware, leading to wide plank European white oak flooring and soaring ceilings up to 10 feet high. Select residences offer grand bay picture windows and Gothic-inspired arched windows, adding a timeless elegance to the space.

The kitchen is a culinary haven, outfitted with custom Italian cabinetry in either Classic Bianco or Modern Grigio lacquer, complemented by Calacatta Laza quartz countertops and a ceramic tile backsplash. A paneled Bosch appliance package, complete with a custom range hood and integrated spice shelf, ensures both style and functionality. Select residences also include a paneled wine refrigerator for the ultimate in convenience.

The primary bathroom is a serene retreat, adorned with Arabescato Cervaiole marble and marble mosaic tile flooring. It features a RAMSA-designed Italian walnut vanity topped with Arabescato Cervaiole marble, polished chrome fixtures by Kallista, a custom mirrored medicine cabinet by Robern, and water closet fixtures by Toto.

Claremont Hall’s extensive amenities span three floors, offering spaces for relaxation, work, and social gatherings. The crown jewel is the Refectory Pool, a historic dining hall transformed into a 48-foot saltwater swimming and event space. Additional amenities include a grand double-height lobby, a Reading Room with the Great Books Collection, a state-of-the-art Gymnasium with Flex Space, the whimsical Little Castle playroom, a media room, and a Residents’ Lounge and Terrace with views of tranquil Sakura Park. Residents also enjoy the convenience of a concierge, handyman, porters, and a live-in resident manager, as well as access to a bicycle room, on-site parking, and private storage for purchase.

Experience the perfect blend of timeless elegance and modern luxury at Claremont Hall.

title: 100 Claremont Avenue #34A
description:
Spanning 1,710 sf of finely detailed living space and occupying Claremont Hall's most
desirable corner, Residence 34A is a three-bedroom, two-bathroom home with a
powder room. This residence offers sweeping southern and western views over the
Hudson River, Riverside and Central Parks, and the iconic spire of Riverside
Cathedral. 34A is centered on a bright and sunny corner living and dining room
that adjoins both a covered outdoor loggia and a windowed kitchen that can be
elegantly concealed behind a solid wood pocket door. The west-facing primary
bedroom suite incorporates a five-fixture bathroom with a deep soaking tub and
large glass-enclosed walk-in shower, and a walk-in closet. Two additional
bedrooms share this residence's spectacular views over the Hudson River, as
well as a conveniently located hall bath.

Displaying a refined finish palette hand-selected by Robert A.M.
Stern Architects, all residences at Claremont Hall include a custom-designed
solid wood entrance door with polished chrome hardware, wide plank European
white oak flooring, expansive, high-performance windows, and up to 10'
ceilings. The kitchens features custom cabinetry topped by quartz
countertops and backed by a ceramic tile backsplash and a paneled appliance
package from Bosch, with a custom range hood with included spice shelf and wine
refrigerator The primary and secondary baths are finished with marble and custom
sconces in polished chrome.

34A has a glorious private outdoor loggias with view of
Riverside Cathedral spire. Each residence conveniently features a washer and dryer
by Bosch.

Claremont Hall's robust amenities span over three floors and
include spaces for socializing, computer time, and relaxing. The experience is
centered on the Refectory Pool, a grand historic dining hall transformed into a
swimming and events space, featuring a 48' salt-water swimming pool. Claremont
Hall is complete with a grand, double-height lobby, a Reading Room with Great
Books Collection, a Gymnasium with Flex Space, the Little Castle playroom,
media room, and a Residents' Lounge and Terrace overlooking tranquil Sakura
Park. The building also features a concierge, handyman, porters, and a live-in
resident manager, as well as a bicycle room, and the opportunity to purchase

title: 457 West 150th Street #1D
description:
This unit is available for move-in immediately and also available unfurnished ($6,000/month).

Be the first to live in this stunning 2BR/2BA duplex apartment at the brand-new Carriage House Lofts, located at 457 West 150th Street between Amsterdam and Convent Avenues.

Apartment 1D is bright and airy, featuring expansive windows that reach up to 15-foot ceilings. The vibe is both open and cozy, enhanced by wide-plank antique spruce wood flooring throughout. In fact, the floors were repurposed from wood beams removed from the original structure to create the new courtyard. The unit includes an in-unit washer/dryer and premium kitchen appliances, such as a dishwasher, induction cooktop, circulating hood, built-in oven, and microwave.

Enjoy the convenience of multi-zone central heating and air-conditioning, allowing separate temperature control in different areas of your home to save money (and the planet). The spa-like bathroom is equipped with chrome Grohe fixtures and a deep tub for ultimate relaxation. The European-style windows are thermally and acoustically insulated to manage sunlight and noise.

Security is paramount in this 26-unit building, safeguarded by multiple cameras in the entryway and common areas. The ButterflyMX intercom system lets you see and speak with visitors, while elevator access is secured via PIN code or smartphone app, ensuring extra safety on residential floors.

The landscaped courtyard, open to all residents during daylight hours, offers various seating arrangements perfect for reading, reflecting, or snacking. The rooftop terrace provides lounge seating and a panoramic view of the Sugar Hill district.

About the Building:

Nestled in the heart of the historic Sugar Hill district of Harlem, a remarkable transformation has taken place at 457 W. 150th Street. A 19th-century carriage house and livery stable, originally built to house horses that raced on the Harlem River Speedway, has been reimagined as a meticulously crafted 26-unit residential rental building. It maintains the original structure’s architectural simplicity and symmetrical design. Originally built in the Neoclassical style in 1920, the building is now ready for its next chapter as a collection of modern studios, 1-, 2-, and 3-bedroom units, available now for rent.

The building’s facade has been beautifully restored to its original splendor, reflecting the architectural grandeur of the Sugar Hill district. Inside, history continues in sustainably repurposed materials: enormous wood beams, salvaged during the creation of the courtyard, have been transformed by a Brooklyn-based wood shop into stunning wide-plank heart pine flooring, featured throughout every unit.

This unique heritage property is now welcoming tenants to write their own chapters within its warm, inviting walls.

title: 321 Convent Avenue #1
description:
Perfectly nestled in a row of historic Queen Anne brownstones, be the very first to experience the meticulously restored 321 Convent Avenue. This home presents a rare opportunity to rent in a classic townhome and piece of Manhattan History which dates back to 1910.

The parlor floor boasts front and central entertaining spaces that features detailed millwork, shuttered windows, restored fireplaces and a Murano glass light fixture. The kitchen features a chefs pantry, and two terrace doors leading to the terrace and backyard, perfectly set up for entertaining and hosting al fresco. 

On the third floor you’re welcomed to the primary suite, complete with a walk in closet, double vanity in the bathroom and soaking tub. Down the hall you’ll find an enormous office and/or bedroom overlooking a quiet treelined block filled with other historic townhouses. 

The fourth floor offers three bedrooms, a laundry room, and 2 full bathrooms. Climb one more flight to access the roof and a sunny entertaining room perfect for a library, playroom, or family den. 

This townhome sits in the heart of evolving Hamilton Heights surrounded by mature trees, block after block of rich history, and just steps away from the bustling retail corridor of 145th Street. The home includes a Nest Thermometer, Central AC, brand new electric and plumbing, and top of the line appliances.

title: 558 West 150th Street #402
description:
Stunning Light-Filled Condo with High-End Finishes

Welcome to unit 402 at 558 West 150th, a beautifully renovated Convertible 2 Bed condominium brimming with character, light, and top-tier finishes. This condo conversion offers a modern, customizable living space featuring central AC and heat, in-unit washer and dryer, 10ft ceilings, and a fully equipped kitchen. The home, which was fully renovated in 2019, offers a flexible layout with the option for two bedrooms or one bedroom plus a den, and is in pristine, like-new condition.

The open-concept floor plan makes entertaining a breeze, with the custom kitchen serving as the heart of the home. It boasts modern shaker cabinetry, sleek quartz countertops, a Bertazzoni stove, and high-end Bosch and Liebherr appliances. The kitchen seamlessly flows into the dining and living areas, which are framed by two large windows that flood the space with natural light. Warmth and charm are added with an exposed faux fireplace and stunning hardwood floors, creating a perfect balance between modern updates and classic details—including two original decorative fireplaces.

The versatile den/office features a large walk-in closet, offering the flexibility you need for work or relaxation. Currently, it comfortably fits a queen-sized bed, with plenty of room to spare.

title: 212 West 91st Street #1114
description:
Since its inception over 99 years ago, every facet of this historic address has been meticulously devised, including its newly renovated apartments. The Greystone brings a boutique hotel-style sensibility to Upper West Side luxury rental living. A landscaped rooftop deck, private lounge, and modern fitness facilities add luxury, vitality, and convenience to your daily life. Freshly revamped apartments boast state-of-the-art appliances and custom cabinetry, all while maintaining their original pre-war design for a peerless look and feel.

Beyond these well-appointed interiors, exists a strong culture and tight-knit community within Greystones walls. This is something that cannot simply be built.

Each one of Greystones Upper West Side studios, 1 and 2 bedrooms has gone through an extensive planning process to ensure that every element of its design maximizes both space and comfort. Appliances, cabinetry, faucets and fixtures are all intuitively laid out, immediately accessible, and simultaneously out of the way. Your living area is further expanded through Greystones modern amenities, which become a seamless extension of your home, instantly available for yourself and your guests to enjoy.

We charge a $35 monthly AC fee during the summer months while you have your air conditioner installed in the window. We install your a/c for you in the spring and remove it in the autumn. When your A/C is removed from the window, the monthly fee stops.
You pay for your own internet/cable tv from Spectrum. 

There is no laundry in the building but there are several convenient laundromats nearby.

This is an excellent neighborhood for grocery shopping with Fairway and Citarella on 75th and Bway, Trader Joe’s at 72nd, and Zabar’s at 80th St.

Also, it’s an easy commute to midtown or local universities with the express subway stop on 72nd St and Bway.

No Dogs (because of severe allergies), but one cat is ok.

We are showing the apartment by appointment only. Please email us for more information.

According to New York Times article from May 27th, 1928 that described the construction of the building:

Video available upon request

“A notable feature of this building is the fact that it will be scientifically sound-proofed, even to the doors. The walls dividing each studio are not only double walls, but the building has been so planned that the studios are separated from each other by intervening chambers, and from the corridors by waiting rooms, pantries, bathrooms etc. In these days of radio, the sound-proof feature should be an interesting feature of all classes of buildings, and the innovation of sound-proofing on this building may be an object lesson worth emulating.”

title: 308 West 82nd Street #11A
description:
Welcome to the epitome of timeless elegance, comfort, and convenience. Nestled on a serene tree-lined street in the heart of the Upper West Side, 308 West 82nd Avenue invites you into a world of pre-war charm seamlessly blended with modern sophistication. Photos of a similar residence, occupied by appointment (available early December). 

This boutique prewar property stands as a testament to refined living, offering a collection of distinctive residences that harmonize effortlessly with your daily lifestyle. Beyond your doorstep, you'll discover an array of dining pleasures, with some of the city's favorite restaurants and convenience centrally located. From Jacob's Pickles to Bareburger, Tacombi to Levain's Bakery, your culinary adventures are endless. If that doesn't satisfy your cravings additional neighborhood options include Playa Bowls, Zabar's Grocery Store or Barnes and Noble for a good read. 

Radiating classic charm, each residence boasts spacious layouts and timeless finishes, creating an ambiance that perfectly complements your daily routines. With Riverside Park just minutes away on one side and the iconic Central Park on the other, this address is a haven for both nature enthusiasts and those with a taste for the arts. The renowned Beacon Theater, American Museum of Natural History, and the Metropolitan Museum of Art are your cultural neighbors, inviting you to explore a world of creativity and inspiration.

Back at the property you'll relish a wealth of amenities designed to elevate your experience. Unwind on the rooftop terrace while taking in breathtaking views of the river and the city skyline. Embrace the convenience of an elevator, maintain your wellness at the on-site gym, and simplify your routine with an on-site laundry room.

Inside your apartment, modernity intertwines with comfort, while hardwood floors extend a warm welcome throughout. 

Lastly with transportation is at your fingertips, with subway lines and cross-town buses mere blocks away Manhattan becomes your backyard, and you can welcome a lifestyle where the essence of history meets the embrace of modernity, where charm, comfort, and connectivity converge in perfect harmony.

According to New York Times article from May 27th, 1928 that described the construction of the building:

“A notable feature of this building is the fact that it will be scientifically sound-proofed, even to the doors. The walls dividing each studio are not only double walls, but the building has been so planned that the studios are separated from each other by intervening chambers, and from the corridors by waiting rooms, pantries, bathrooms etc. In these days of radio, the sound-proof feature should be an interesting feature of all classes of buildings, and the innovation of sound-proofing on this building may be an object lesson worth emulating.”

title: 210 Riverside Drive #12DE
description:
Apartment 12E at 210 Riverside Drive is a beautifully renovated, top floor, corner three bedroom, two-and-a-half-bathroom home with views of the River and Park from nearly every window, as well as open city views to the east. Entrance to the residence commences in a white marble and mirrored foyer with an adjacent tiled powder room, that is perfect for guests. The grand and gracious layout benefits from the old-world scale and details that blend seamlessly with modern comforts throughout. The impressive scale is enhanced by over 10'-high ceilings and thirteen oversized windows showcasing dramatic direct and oblique views of the Hudson River, Joan of Arc Park, and Riverside Park from all but two of them, and those windows have unobstructed city views, moon and sunrises! This extraordinary vantage point highlights all the splendor of every season while providing breathtaking daylight no matter the weather and sunsets at days end.

Contemporized prewar details throughout include wide plank quarter-sewn oak floors, custom crown and baseboard moldings, decorative built-ins, beamed ceilings, and Mahogany doors with brushed nickel hardware and glass transoms. Contemporary conveniences include central air conditioning with individual room control, recessed halogen lighting, luxurious baths (one with soaking tub and one with glass shower with dual shower heads, oversized mirrored cabinets with LED lights and towel warmer in the other) with radiant heat floors and double vanities, ample washer/dryer closet, and generous custom closet storage.

210 Riverside Drive is an elegant, full-service cooperative built in 1909. The 12-story building was designed by Schwartz & Gross, one of the most prolific architectural firms in the city of that era. Amenities include a doorman/elevator operator (7:30 am – 1:30 am) and live-in superintendent, laundry room if needed for larger items/loads, and a bicycle room. Pets are permitted.

title: 220 Manhattan Avenue #6V
description:
This spacious two bedroom apartment, overlooks a quiet garden that belongs to the building and has bit of a Central Park view as well! It has been freshly re-finished by the owners with freshly painted Baker's White walls and gleaming wooden floors. Each bedroom can accommodate a king-sized bed but the primary has an additional alcove and a very large walk-in and walk-around closet! The kitchen has all stainless steel appliances including a built-in microwave, new dishwasher and a large fridge with three feezer drawers as well as a gas range. The kitchen cabinets have been freshly finished in the same wood finishes as the doors and the floors in the rest of the apartment. The bathroom has just been cleaned and re-grouted with a tub, sink, three mirror vanity and under-sink storage. Custom closets and storage spaces abound throughout the apartment from a large built-in in the living area to one in the smaller bedroom and a large utility closet right outside the bathroom.

The apartment is part of a well-estabilished condominium named "Towers on the Park" which include three buildings on the Northwest corner of Central Park. With access to both Morningside and Central Parks and a supermarket in the building, a subway stop on the premisis, two cafes on the Frederick Douglass Circle and restaurants up Frederick Douglass Boulevard, down Columbus and all over Broadway, it is ideally situated. There are three full-time front-desks and a large staff that serve the buildings. Five buses ply the area to bring you up from the Village across to the Costco on the East River, go up and down Central Park West as well as Fifth Avenue and Madison as well as the M4 that goes all the way up Broadway past three Columbia University campusses to the Cloisters (the medieval branch of the Metropolitan Museum). Additional facilities under construction include a swimming pool and ice skating rink in the Northern part of Central Park as well as three Conservatory Gardens a little further East past the Harlem Meer. This part of Central Park is less touristy and has more attractions for those who live in the area.

For a tour of the apartment and the area, please call or email me.

title: 225 West 86th Street #1006
description:
Modern sophistication meets coveted historic provenance in this sprawling four-bedroom, three and a half-bathroom home featuring sun-kissed interiors and near-endless amenities at the Upper West Side’s storied Belnord condominium. The expansive corner layout is the most sought out line in the building as it boasts a dozen oversized southern and eastern windows, flooding every room with sunlight. Enjoy an ideal layout for relaxing and entertaining, beginning with a gracious entry hall with two large closets and an adjacent powder room. Ahead, the corner living room stretches nearly 30 feet long, creating a generous footprint for comfortable living. The oversized eat-in kitchen boasts walls of floor-to-ceiling custom cabinetry, a large pantry, and a center island with dishwasher. Off the kitchen, you’ll find a laundry closet and a secondary suite with a private bath ideal for guests or staff.

In the main bedroom wing, the primary suite invites a calm respite with a king-size bedroom, a wall of wardrobes and two walk-in closets. The newly renovated ensuite bathroom impresses with a soaking tub, a separate glass shower, a double vanity, and stone finishes. Two more secondary bedrooms sharing a convenient Jack-and-Jill bathroom complete this exceptional home. 

Described as “a village in the city,” The Belnord is a cherished New York City landmark reimagined for discerning New Yorkers. Enjoy a regal sense of arrival via the iconic gated porte-cochère and residential driveway alongside a manicured courtyard. The 24-hour attended lobby offers convenient cold storage and a package room. The Belnord Club delivers world-class amenities, including a state-of-the-art fitness, sports court, locker rooms and a sauna. A fireplace lounge, teen lounge, children’s playroom, and private dining room with an adjacent kitchen round out the exceptional living experience. 

Perfectly situated between Broadway and Amsterdam, you can explore all the Upper West Side has to offer including hundreds of acres of iconic outdoor space with Riverside Park and Central Park just two blocks away. Transportation is effortless with the 1 train right outside your door plus 2/3, B and C lines, excellent bus service and CitiBikes all nearby. 

Please note some of these photos are virtually staged.
